bibl.title: Letter from The Mercantile Bank to Henry Rose Carter, May 25, 1922

div1.p: The Mercantile Bank of the Americas instructs a bank in Peru to convert Carter's deposit into dollars.

div1.head: Letter from The Mercantile Bank to Henry Rose Carter, May 25, 1922
div1.opener:
CABLE ADDRESS
BAMERICAS, NEW YORK
UNDER SUPERVISION OF THE FEDERAL RESERVE BOARD
MERCANTILE BANK OF THE AMERICAS
INCORPORATED
AN AMERICAN BANK FOR FOREIGN TRADE
44 PINE STREET NEW YORK
IN REPLYING PLEASE MENTION FAH/R
May 25, 1922.
Mr. H. R. Carter,
c/o Dr. Calvin Goddard,
529 North Wolf Street,
Baltimore, Md.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
We acknowledge receipt of your undated letter
inquiring whether we had received your letter of May 20th,
meaning no doubt of May 21st, which letter we duly received.

As in your previous correspondence you had not
mentioned that you desired us to communicate by cable with
the Banco Mercantil Americano del Perú, we communicated
with them by letter. However, in view of your letter under
reply, we have cancelled our letter and have cabled them as
follows:

“H.R. Carter holder of certificate of de-
posit #1240 £p. 1,000 authorizes you to
accept Dr. Henry Hanson's instructions for
conversion of this deposit into dollars. 20=100
Advise Hanson. Forward us dollar certifi-
cate for delivery to Carter against surren-
der of certificate £p.”

The cost of the above cable is $14.60, and we
shall appreciate your forwarding us your check for this
amount by return mail.
div1.closer:
Yours very truly, MERCANTILE BANK OF THE AMERICAS, Inc.
[unclear] Assistant Secretary.
